sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Relief for more than 4 million Ukrainian refugees currently living in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The European Council on Thursday agreed to extend the temporary protection status for refugees fleeing the war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This grants them the certainty that they will be allowed to stay in the bloc until March 2025 without the need to examine individual applications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The European Commissioner for Home Affairs says approximately 250,000 people per week cross the borders between Ukraine and the EU in both directions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's been the fastest growing refugee crisis faced by Europe since World War II, and the EU has repeated that it will continue to support the people of Ukraine as long as it takes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The year-long extension will give Ukrainians living in the European Union more certainty as the war in their country drags on.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Triggered days after Moscow's invasion of Ukraine in February 2022, the temporary protection status gives them the right to residency and housing in European Union countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It also means they are allowed to work, their children can attend school and they can access medical and social welfare assistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Temporary protection is an EU emergency mechanism which is activated in exceptional circumstances of mass influx and was first adopted in 2001.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: EU countries say they're very close to striking a deal on how to manage sudden massive arrivals of migrants in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The so-called crisis regulation, as it's being called, allows member states to quickly admit people in need of international protection, but also extends the deadlines to fast-track asylum applications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Not all countries are on board, though.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: During the negotiations, Italy and Germany clashed about a reference to NGO vessels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But the Spanish EU presidency is still confident of reaching an agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is the last missing piece to be agreed among member states when it comes to the EU's migration pact, which is the reform of migratory policy proposed by the European Commission in 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: EU countries already agreed measures to change the asylum system aimed at alleviating pressure on frontline member states like Italy and Greece.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Once everything is eventually agreed, the Council will have to negotiate the entire migration pact with the European Parliament, where positions vary massively.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One point being that some member states don't consider mandatory relocations among the EU countries a solution to a crisis situation. But the Parliament is insisting on this point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Yes, I know that there's reluctance, there's resistance, but yes, the pro-European majority in the European Parliament has made it clear in our mandate for negotiation that we want, in situations of crisis, mandatory relocation programmes, which is the European scale of response in a situation as the one which is enduring now Lampedusa. The EU aims to reach an agreement on the migration pact before the end of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Individual member states won't have a right to veto it if they disagree, since the decision will be taken by a qualified majority of EU countries.
